page.title: 08GREEN'S VINEYARD,MORETON
page.content: Green's Vineyard is only a small part of Ongar Farms Ltd..The vineyard covers 3 acres.It contains 3500 vines. There is only one person working in the vineyard, except at vintage time, which is October and November, when they are helped by casual labour. It only takes one day to pick the grapes.It takes 7-8 years for the vines to produce fruit. The grapes grown are Muller Thugan, Schonberger, Wurzer, Kerner and Scheurebe. They are all German Hybrids, which are bred for cooler climates. The grapes are picked into boxes, which then go off to Chilford Hall to be made into white wine. The 1984 vintage produced 1200 litres of wine. If the weather is particularly cold you can expect the vineyard to be about 3 weeks behind.
